reasoning: X-linked intellectual disability (XLID) is a genetically heterogeneous group of conditions caused by mutations in genes on the X chromosome. Reported as prevalence rather than incidence since this is a lifelong genetic condition. Population prevalence estimated at ~1.2% (12,000 per 100k), primarily affecting males. XLID accounts for 5-10% of all intellectual disability cases globally.
source: Ropers HH. (2010). X-linked mental retardation: genes, proteins, and clinical features. J Clin Invest. 120(11):4131-4140
